# discord_emojis (Data Source)

Retrieves all custom emojis from a Discord guild (server).

## Example Usage

```terraform
terraform {
  required_providers {
    discord = {
      source  = "tfstack/discord"
      version = "~> 0.1"
    }
  }
}

provider "discord" {}

data "discord_emojis" "all" {
  guild_id = "1452601985235816601" # Replace with your guild ID
}

output "emoji_names" {
  value = [for emoji in data.discord_emojis.all.emojis : emoji.name]
}

output "animated_emojis" {
  value = [
    for emoji in data.discord_emojis.all.emojis :
    emoji.name
    if emoji.animated == true
  ]
}

output "emoji_ids" {
  value = [for emoji in data.discord_emojis.all.emojis : emoji.id]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `guild_id` (String) The ID of the Discord guild (server).

### Read-Only

- `emojis` (Attributes List) List of custom emojis in the guild. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--emojis))

<a id="nestedatt--emojis"></a>
### Nested Schema for `emojis`

Read-Only:

- `animated` (Boolean) Whether the emoji is animated.
- `available` (Boolean) Whether the emoji is available for use.
- `id` (String) The ID of the emoji.
- `managed` (Boolean) Whether the emoji is managed by an integration.
- `name` (String) The name of the emoji.
- `require_colons` (Boolean) Whether the emoji requires colons to be used.
- `roles` (List of String) List of role IDs that can use this emoji. Empty if available to all roles.
- `user` (String) The ID of the user who created the emoji.
